alert.note: Alert for Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 3:02PM CDT until March 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR WESTERN WOODFORD...NORTHEASTERN TAZEWELL AND SOUTHEASTERN PEORIA COUNTIES... At 301 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near East Peoria, or near Peoria, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Trained spotter reported golf ball size hail in Peoria Heights at 3:00 PM CDT. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Washington, Germantown Hills, Spring Bay and Bay View Gardens around 305 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Metamora. This includes the following highways... Interstate 474 between mile markers 6 and 14. Interstate 74 between mile markers 91 and 102. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
